snippet: President Yahya Jammeh returned to Gambia on Wednesday and accused dissidents backed by foreign powers of mounting an attack on the capital the day before.
abstract: Gambian Pres Yahya Jammeh accuses dissidents based in US, Germany and Britain for recent attack on the capital and presidential palace and dismisses talk that it was an attempted coup even though antagonists are former members of Gambia's military.
lead_paragraph: President Yahya Jammeh returned to Gambia on Wednesday and accused dissidents backed by foreign powers of mounting an attack on the capital the day before.

headline.main: Gambia: President Says Palace Attack Was Conducted by ‘Terrorist Groups’
headline.print_headline: Gambia: President Says Palace Attack Was Conducted by ‘Terrorist Groups’

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
